alert.note: Alert for Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 11:31AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Weston and southern Crook Counties through NOON MDT... At 1131 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles east of Devils Tower National Monument to 2 miles east of Moorcroft. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cook Lake around 1150 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Warren Peak. This includes Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 151 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly.

area.areaDesc: Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills
